places.name: Panama Canal
places.description: One of the world’s most impressive engineering feats, the Panama Canal connects the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans, offering a fascinating experience through its locks and historical sites.

places.name: Casco Viejo
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, this charming colonial district features colorful buildings, cobblestone streets, and vibrant nightlife, offering a peek into Panama’s rich history and culture.

places.name: Bocas del Toro
places.description: A popular tourist destination known for its vibrant nightlife, beautiful beaches, snorkeling, and diving opportunities in crystal-clear waters.

places.name: Boquete
places.description: Nestled in the mountains, Boquete offers hiking, coffee tours, and a cooler climate, perfect for nature lovers and those wanting to experience Panama’s scenic countryside.

places.name: San Blas Islands
places.description: A beautiful archipelago of over 300 islands, perfect for relaxing on white-sand beaches, swimming, and immersing in the indigenous Guna Yala culture.

places.name: Coiba National Park
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this park is famous for its biodiversity, offering incredible opportunities for snorkeling, diving, and wildlife spotting.

places.name: Metropolitan Natural Park
places.description: This urban rainforest is a tranquil escape with hiking trails, bird watching, and a panoramic view of Panama City.

places.name: Pearl Islands
places.description: A secluded paradise offering crystal-clear waters, perfect for diving, snorkeling, and exploring remote beaches.
